post.description: Create or edit an alias. An alias allows to have __mutable__ content (up to 1000 chars), i.e. you can use this as an on-chain Name Service, or other interesting things. Additionally, it's possible to trade aliases!

parameters.name: aliasName
parameters.description: If not exists already, you create an alias with the given __unique__ name. If you are the owner of the alias, then you can update the content. - Like a database _upsert_ operation.

parameters.name: aliasURI
parameters.description:
Sets/Updates the arbitrary _content_ of this alias.
Historically, the alias system was considered for Name Service operations only, that's why it is called URI.
The legacy format for account aliases is `acct:@burst`. You may check for that format for legacy account aliases
